title: Nethermind constantly seals empty blocks
body:
Nethermind constantly seals empty blocks on spaceneth after calling eth_sendRawTransaction

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run node with command .\Nethermind.Runner.exe --config 'spaceneth.cfg' 
2. Send transaction using Web3.py
    ETHEREUM_NODE = HTTPProvider(ETHEREUM_NODE_ADDRESS)
    WEB3 = Web3(ETHEREUM_NODE)
    signed_txn = WEB3.eth.account.signTransaction(
        dict(
            nonce=nonce,
            gasPrice=WEB3.toWei('0.001', 'gwei'),
            gas=100000,
            to=address,
            value=WEB3.toWei(amount, unit)
        ),
        private_key)
   WEB3.eth.sendRawTransaction(signed_txn.rawTransaction)

Transaction should be successfully mined and only on block sealed.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36704178/175012452-aca25a49-0698-4e94-9450-03c2621cb8fb.png)


 - OS: Windows 10
 - Web3.py

in spaceneth, the block production is triggered every 200ms when the transaction pool is not empty ( can be configured to behave differently ).
Now the transaction you are submitting has the gas fee lower than the base fee for the block, which is 1GWei at genesis for spaceneth. So every 200ms a block is being produced (as there is a transaction in the pool) but the transaction cannot be include in the block due to the low gas fees. 
It will keep on producing blocks until transaction is included in the block.

It will keep on producing blocks until transaction is included in the block.

I can see that "minGasLimit": "0x1388" which is 5000. Is this the minimum Wei for one block to be mined? I cannot find the 200ms block sealing period. Can you clear this out for me?

here is the parameter - its not in the config file https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Consensus.Ethash/NethDevPlugin.cs#L106
For the gas fees: its not the direct. Since EIP1559 there are two parts of the fees - BaseFee + PriorityFee 
- for setting baseFee of the genesis block you can add the `baseFeePerGas` key to `genesis` part in spaceneth.json
- for setting the minimum priority fee, you can add the following block to spaceneth.cfg
`
"Mining" : {
    "MinGasPrice": 1000000000
 }
 `

> can be configured to behave differently ).

Thank you! I've managed to pass this issue by increasing the gas price in my transactions. Now the problem is that I cannot find the transaction using WEB3.eth.getTransactionReceipt(tx_hash). It returns:
web3.exceptions.TransactionNotFound: Transaction with hash: b'\xba\x17\xea[\xf5.\x06k\x17M\xde\xfee\x19W<\x87\xcf\x08\x1e3\xe0J%\xeb\x989\xfb\xf7;~\xc3' not found.
The node logs look fine:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36704178/175309848-4f3f7774-e780-4cf7-bec0-c77d33727c7a.png)

I tried also to deploy a contract and for that I used WEB3.eth.waitForTransactionReceipt(tx_hash, timeout=None) to get the receipt and now I get a similar behavior as the first time. A lot of empty blocks sealed and eth_getTransactionReceipt with no response:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36704178/175310508-ec69593e-3766-477e-8785-217620f559a4.png)

 I believe that sealing empty blocks should not happen regardless of circumstances (how could this be configured?). And also the fact the getTransactionReceipt is not working seems to be an issue.

in the first case, looking at the logs, i believe you are calling ` WEB3.eth.getTransactionReceipt(tx_hash)` right after sending the transaction. You have to wait for it to be included in the block first

for the second case, can you send me the raw transaction, i can check and let you know what the issue might be.

you need some kind of a trigger for block production. The trigger can be configured and even be removed (trigger block production manually). But you will have to make changes in the code and rebuild the client. the changes can me made here: https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Consensus.Ethash/NethDevPlugin.cs#L106

If we want to keep the consensus similar to that of ethereum, then we cannot include transaction the are less than baseFee, it would be a consensus issue.
As for empty blocks, i think it is the correct behavior. With each empty block the baseFee decreases and eventually the transaction gets included. If we stop producing empty blocks, that transaction will never get included in a block.
One thing that would help is adding another filter that does not accept transaction that will never be included in a block. Currently we have a setting for the min value accepted for the priorityGasFee. What we can do is add a filter that does not add transaction to the txPool such that tx.gasFees < minPrioirtyGasFee + minPossibleBaseFee. 
For the current spaceneth config ( minPrioirtyGasFee = 1GWei, genesisBaseFee = 1GWei ), after around 50 empty block the baseFee reduces to the lowest - 7Wei. So we should have a filter that does not accept tx such that tx.gasFees < 1GWei + 7Wei.

And yes, both, minPriorityFee and genesisBaseFee are configurable using config and chainSpec files respectively.
